data.title: Infodemiology.com
data.text:
For public health

The first U.S.-based trainings on infodemiology for public health professionals. Over 10 hours of tailored curriculum by U.S. experts, free and online.

For health care

Short, flexible modules designed to improve patient care in today’s complex information landscape, free and online.

In-person training

Contact us for more information on customizable in-person trainings and workshops for your team or organization.

Training for journalism and public health

First Draft is no longer active, but its website is maintained and offers excellent training.

View resources

The most comprehensive public health training resource

A gateway into the TRAIN Learning Network, with many trainings related to infodemiology.

View resources

Improve vaccine discussions in your practice

Scenario-based trainings for health care providers to improve patient communication.

View resources

Training on infodemic management

The original infodemic management training launched in 2020 by WHO.

View resources

Training for health communications professionals

Experienced public health leaders, with the communications insight you need.

View resources

Reputable journalism training, often applicable to infodemiology

Free and paid training on relevant topics like fact-checking and media literacy.

View resources

Online discussions about bird flu are recycling COVID-19 narratives

Reports of the H5N1 virus being detected in cow’s milk have kept the outbreak in the news and in social media conversations.

View resources

Foundational paper on infodemiology and infoveillance

In this key paper, founder of infodemiology Dr. Gunther Eysenbach establishes a framework for the field.

View resources

Practical playbook for addressing health misinformation

A hands-on approach to help recognize and respond to health-related rumors and misinformation.

View resources

Media monitoring resources

Dashboards on this site are provided by Talkwalker, which offers its own resources.

View resources

Public Health Communications Collaborative

Supports public health communicators to be timely, clear, credible, & effective messengers.

View resources

Measles outbreaks brief

The Monitoring Lab reports on measles outbreak and vaccine narratives in the U.S.

View resources

JMIR Infodemiology

The first and only peer-reviewed journal specifically dedicated to infodemiology.

View resources
